title: Learn Next.js in Just 15 Minutes
author: Dawar bhai
content:
Next.js is a full-stack React framework that enables scalable and fast web development. With built-in routing, API support, and performance optimizations, it's the go-to for modern apps. --- ## 1. What is Next.js? A React framework for building production-grade apps â€” includes routing, SSR, SSG, API routes, and file/image optimization. --- ## 2. Installation (Next.js 14+) ```bash npx create-next-app@latest my-app # Select App Router (recommended) cd my-app npm run dev ``` Visit: `http://localhost:3000` --- ## 3. File-Based Routing (App Router) Every folder inside `/app` becomes a route. ```txt /app/page.js â†’ '/' /app/about/page.js â†’ '/about' ``` Example: ```js // app/about/page.js export default function About() { return

About Us

; } ``` --- ## 4. Navigation with `next/link` ```js import Link from 'next/link'; About ``` --- ## 5. Styling with Tailwind CSS ```bash npm install -D tailwindcss postcss autoprefixer npx tailwindcss init -p ``` Update `tailwind.config.js` and use classes: ```js

Welcome

``` --- ## 6. Dynamic Routes ```txt /app/blog/[slug]/page.js â†’ '/blog/my-post' ``` Read `params.slug` in server component: ```js export default function Page({ params }) { return

Blog: {params.slug}

; } ``` --- ## 7. Metadata (SEO) Use metadata for SEO directly in components: ```js export const metadata = { title: 'My Blog', description: 'Learn about stuff.' }; ``` --- ## 8. API Routes (via `app/api`) ```js // app/api/hello/route.js export async function GET() { return Response.json({ message: 'Hello from API' }); } ``` --- ## 9. Fetching Data (Server-Side) Use `async` functions directly in server components. ```js async function getData() { const res = await fetch('https://api.example.com/posts'); return res.json(); } export default async function Page() { const data = await getData(); return 
{JSON.stringify(data)}
; } ``` --- ## 10. Image Optimization Built-in image component for performance: ```js import Image from 'next/image'; ``` --- ## 11. Middleware (Advanced) For auth, redirects, logging: ```js // middleware.js import { NextResponse } from 'next/server'; export function middleware(request) { return NextResponse.next(); } ``` --- ## 12. Deployment Deploy on Vercel: ```bash npm run build npm start ``` Or push to GitHub and connect to [https://vercel.com](https://vercel.com) --- ## Final Thoughts Next.js 14+ is fast, flexible, and production-ready. With the new `app` directory and server components, it's never been easier to build modern full-stack apps. **Build smart. Deploy fast. â€” Dawar bhai ðŸš€**
